title: 10 more fun, niche, weird apps for Android (volume 2)
description: You'll probably never use these apps, but they're here if you need them.

title: Real world photos show the Pixel Tablet in a new color
description: The images show two colors we know about and one we're seeing for the first time.

title: Apple might not allow sideloading on iPhones in the US, because why would it?
description: To double down, Apple might even charge developers to be a part of the sideloading feature.

title: You can now use Bard for coding or help with Google Sheets functions
description: Bard can help with over 20 programming languages.

title: Secretive startup previews AI-powered wearable projector
description: There's no information on when this pocketable wearable may be available.

title: How to open and set up your Apple Card Savings account
description: Sit back and let your money grow with an Apple Card Savings account!

title: Apple Card Savings account: Everything you need to know
description: Do you want a high-yield savings account with a high APY?

title: Does Peacock have live TV?
description: We cover what's included with your Peacock subscription at the free and paid tiers.

title: Google Assistant will stop narrating every little detail about its actions soon
description: Just shut off the lights, Google; I don't need your life story on the matter.

title: Galaxy Watch 6 might have a new processor, unlike the Galaxy Watch 5
description: This would be the first wearable SoC upgrade from Samsung since the Galaxy Watch 4.

title: Big Pixel Fold leak reveals the price, release date, and much more
description: The leak suggests the Pixel Fold will be pretty expensive.

title: Android now has a smart solution for crashing apps
description: The feature will be available on Android 7.0 devices or later.

title: The Google Pixel 7a could offer face unlock support
description: It likely won't be on par with the Pixel 4's 3D face unlock, but it would be a welcome feature anyway.

title: The Motorola Razr 2023 is officially coming, and here’s the first teaser video
description: It looks like you should expect a larger cover screen and dual cameras at the very least.
